intro: Argyrocalymma denticulatum, commonly known as the silver-leafed daisy or the coastal daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silvery foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs that give it a distinctive appearance and help reduce water loss. Argyrocalymma denticulatum is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and adaptability to arid conditions.
